intro: Sabulina ramosissima, commonly known as the branched sandwort, is a flowering plant native to the northern regions of North America. It is a member of the Montiaceae family and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant features slender, branched stems covered in small, fleshy leaves that are often arranged in a rosette. It produces small, white to pink flowers that bloom in late spring or early summer. Sabulina ramosissima thrives in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments.
